context_evidences: - In the federal indictment, prosecutors said the men arranged for money and a list of candidates, including themselves, to be delivered to voters. The indictment did not identify the voters who received money, the intermediaries used to deliver money and candidate lists or the other candidates on the lists. Reference: https://www.wafb.com/2022/07/22/guilty-pleas-louisiana-vote-buying-case/ published on 2022-07-22 15:00:55

- Trabona pleaded guilty to one conspiracy count. Hart pleaded guilty to the same count, which involved the 2016 election, and three counts involving elections in 2016 and 2020. Reference: https://www.wafb.com/2022/07/22/guilty-pleas-louisiana-vote-buying-case/ published on 2022-07-22 15:00:55

- A former Amite City police chief and an Amite city council member were sentenced on Tuesday, November 29 to one year in prison for violating federal election laws, according to the Department of Justice (DOJ). Reference: https://www.wafb.com/2022/11/30/three-sentenced-including-former-police-chief-city-council-member-2016-vote-buying-case/ published on 2022-11-30 21:40:35

- The press release also said that two other Louisiana men, Calvin Batiste and Louis Ruffino, previously pleaded guilty to their involvement and will be sentenced at a later date. Reference: https://www.klfy.com/louisiana/former-louisiana-police-chief-city-council-member-sentenced-in-vote-buying-scheme/ published on 2022-11-30 22:45:42

- Court documents revealed that Trabona and Hart agreed to pay or offer to pay voters residing in Tangipahoa Parish for voting during the 2016 open primary election and the 2016 open general election, contests in which Trabona and Hart were both candidates. Reference: https://www.klfy.com/louisiana/former-louisiana-police-chief-city-council-member-sentenced-in-vote-buying-scheme/ published on 2022-11-30 22:45:42

- Two other Louisiana men who previously pleaded guilty for their involvement in the vote buying scheme, Calvin Batiste and Louis Ruffino, will be sentenced at a later date. Reference: https://www.wafb.com/2022/11/30/three-sentenced-including-former-police-chief-city-council-member-2016-vote-buying-case/ published on 2022-11-30 21:40:35
correction_response:
This tweet is accurate but slightly misleading. Former police chief Jerry Trabona and former councilman Kris Hart were indeed sentenced to one year in prison for violating federal election laws in a vote-buying scheme. However, the tweet fails to mention that they are no longer in office and that this scheme took place during the 2016 elections. Also, it's worth noting that two other individuals, Calvin Batiste and Louis Ruffino, were also involved and have pleaded guilty, but their sentencing will occur at a later date. 
References: 
https://www.klfy.com/louisiana/former-louisiana-police-chief-city-council-member-sentenced-in-vote-buying-scheme/
https://www.wafb.com/2022/11/30/three-sentenced-including-former-police-chief-city-council-member-2016-vote-buying-case/
note_1_text: Trabona & Hart pled guilty to conspiring to pay voters to vote for them for Police Chief & for City Council, respectively,  in the 2016 election in Tangipahoa Parish, LA. For context, 1,841 TOTAL votes were cast in the Police Chief race and 377 in the Council race.    https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/former-louisiana-police-chief-city-councilmember-and-additional-co-conspirator-sentenced-vote  https://voterportal.sos.la.gov/Graphical
note_2_text: Jerry Trabona is a 79-year-old who registered to vote in Louisiana 43 years ago. He is registered as an Independent. https://voterrecords.com/voter/84458416/jerry-trabona
